name: Kachingle
tag_list: freemium, premium, micropayment, micropayments, micro-payment, micro-payments, bundle, bundling, social-media, crowd-funding, crowdsourcing
overview:
Kachingle is a robust usage-based micropayment platform capable of collecting and distributing monies in a myriad of different ways.

Kachingle bundles various vendors’ PC/MAC/SaaS/Web premium apps and offers them together at an irresistible price. This fits in nicely with freemium vendors’ offerings and bridges the “penny gap” that all vendors experience. Payments to a vendor are based upon subscriber visits and how many new subscribers a vendor brings into a bundle’s growing subscriber pool. And subscribers benefit with the simplicity of a single sign up, a single subscription charge and full use of the entire bundle’s premium apps.

Vendors wanting to cross–market will find bundling not only introduces products into new markets but is an efficient way to maximize sales and satisfy customers’ needs. Kachingle bundles can be very flexible. Companies can own their own bundles and set the ground rules for them. Not all applications need to be treated as equals. A bundle owner may have a core product, take a specified cut of the revenue, and bundle third-party vendor applications around it. With Kachingle’s point-based system subscribers can buy best-of-class software, use only what the need or can afford, and avert the high entry cost barrier.

Kachingle Anything is Kachingle’s two-year-up-and-running monetary distribution service that allows web content providers a new and reliable revenue stream. Subscribers make five dollar voluntary contributions that are distributed to content providers based upon traffic to content. The model takes full advantage of the web’s social networking and crowdfunding possibilities.
